title: The defense rests in Sam Bankman-Fried criminal trial
description: Bankman-Fried plays defense as his criminal trial draws to a close

title: Tesla Autopilot not responsible for fatal crash, jury says
description: The verdict is pivotal for Tesla, which for years has argued it’s not responsible when one of its cars crashes while using the driver-assistance technology.

title: Would you pay $17 a month for Facebook and Instagram?
description: Europeans will soon have the option to pay to stop ads in Meta apps. Yes, there’s a catch.

title: Apple warns Indian opposition and journalists of state-backed hacking
description: The government has denied interfering in anyone’s phones but the warning recalls the 2021 allegations that authorities in India used Pegasus surveillance system against opponents.

title: Key takeaways from our deep look at the creator economy
description: “The Creator Economy,” a series from The Washington Post, examines the industry of online influence and its impact on American culture, media and power.

title: News on TikTok and Instagram is booming, signaling a new era
description: A recent report found that while the audience for traditional news outlets is shrinking, the online audience for independent news sources is growing.

title: High court weighs whether officials may block critics on social media
description: The cases present a fresh opportunity to decide whether and when public officials can block individual critics from their private social media accounts.

title: World leaders are gathering at the U.K.’s AI Summit. Doom is on the agenda.
description: Featuring Vice President Harris, Tesla CEO Elon Musk and other top executives, the U.K.’s global AI summit has highlighted diverging priorities between the prime minister and the White House.
